meanings.sent1: The agelong friendship between Sarah and Emily never faded.
meanings.sent2: The oak tree stood agelong in the meadow, witnessing generations pass by.
meanings.sent3: The agelong debate over the best ice cream flavor finally ended with a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as agelong as the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins bore witness to the agelong history of the civilization.

meanings.definition: Existing or continuing for a very long time
meanings.sent1: The agelong tradition of celebrating harvest festivals brought joy to the village.
meanings.sent2: The agelong oak tree provided shade for countless picnics over the years.
meanings.sent3: The agelong clock in the town square suddenly chimed in the middle of the night, startling everyone.
meanings.sent4: The agelong melody of the river flowing soothed her troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: The agelong bond between the siblings was unbreakable, no matter the distance.

meanings.sent1: The story of the legendary hero spread agelong across the land.
meanings.sent2: The wisdom of the elders was passed down agelong to the younger members of the tribe.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children echoed agelong through the halls of the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was known agelong in the small town, earning her the title of the 'neighborhood angel'.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset lingered agelong in his memory, a moment frozen in time.
